member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.FontSettings
member.summary: Contains font related settings which are used when printing, importing or exporting a presentation to a file format that requires font information.

remarks.para: Setting the custom fonts location is usually used in medium trust environments to bypass file system operations restrictions imposed for file locations that are not under the application's jurisdiction.
For more information, see private fonts example.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.FontSettings.FontsBaseUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the base where component looks for fonts. path should end with or .
member.value: The base where component looks for fonts.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.FontSettings.FontsBaseDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the base directory path where component looks for fonts. Directory path can be absolute or relative to .
member.value: The base directory path where component looks for fonts.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.FontSettings.FontsBaseResourceLocation

summary.para: Gets or sets the base resource location where component looks for fonts specified as resources inside the local or referenced assembly.
Read Remarks for details about the format of the for Windows and Web applications.

member.value: The base resource location where component looks for fonts specified as resources inside the local or referenced assembly.

note.para: When you add fonts as resources to your application, make sure you are setting the <Resource> element, and not the <EmbeddedResource> element in your application's project file.
The <EmbeddedResource> element for the build action is not supported.

remarks.para: Following image shows an example of a Windows Console project structure with font files added as resources.
Following table illustrates the various base resource locations that you can specify to use fonts from the above Windows Console project structure.
Resource locations consist of required and adjustable parts.

tr.td: Font resource files are in the root of local assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of local assembly.
Font resource files are in the root of referenced assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of referenced assembly.

remarks.para: Following image shows an example of a Web ASP.NET project structure with font files added as resources.
Following table illustrates the various base resource locations that you can specify to use fonts from the above Web ASP.NET project structure.
Since ASP.NET assembly is actually a class library referenced from ASP.NET web server, resource location must always include ;component part.

tr.td: Font resource files are in the root of local assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of local assembly.
Font resource files are in the root of referenced assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of referenced assembly.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.ImageSaveOptions.SlideCount

summary.para: Gets or sets the number of slides which should be saved to a multi-frame image.
If image format doesn't support multiple frames, this property is ignored.
Default value is 1.
To save all slides, set value to .
Only Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) and Graphics Interchange Format (GIF) format images support multiple frames.

member.value: The number of slides which should be saved to a multi-frame image.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.ImageSaveOptions.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the image width in pixels.
member.value: The image width in pixels.

remarks.para: If both and are not specified, then image size will be equal to the slide size.
If only one of the or is specified, then the specified dimension will be respected and other dimension will be calculated so that original aspect ratio is maintained.
If both and are specified, then both specified dimensions will be respected (which may result in non-uniformly scaled image, if aspect ratio is not equal to the original one.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.ImageSaveOptions.MetafileScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images. Greater scaling factor improves quality but also increases file size. Default value is 1.
member.value: The metafile scale factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images.

remarks.para: Windows Metafile Format (WMF) and Enhanced Metafile Format (EMF) are vector image formats which contain a series of graphics drawing commands usually executed in Windows GDI layer.
Metafile drawing commands could also be executed in PDF (or XPS) file which is also vector format, but for that Metafile drawing commands would have to be converted to PDF drawing commands.

GemBox.Presentation currently doesn't perform this conversion of drawing commands, instead it uses Windows GDI to execute Metafile drawing commands into bitmap which is then encoded to PNG format and embedded into PDF file.
specifies the size of the bitmap surface, based from the original Metafile surface size, into which Metafile should be drawn / rasterized.

PDF viewer will still scale the bitmap to the original Metafile size, but if the page is zoomed or viewed on a larger surface, quality of the image will be better since it contains more pixels / dots which will become visible while PDF viewer scales down the image.

increases the quality of the Metafile image in PDF file, but it also increases the size of the PDF file because greater means greater bitmap surface and more space to store bitmap pixel / color data. PNG encoding / compression helps in reducing the space requirement and for complex Metafiles (with a lot of drawing instructions), of 5 or even greater, might not incur any space overhead relative to the original (complex) Metafile.
Default value for is 1.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.ImageSaveOptions.ContentType
member.summary:

image/png if is ,
image/jpeg if is ,
image/gif if is ,
image/bmp if is ,
image/tiff if is ,
image/vnd.ms-photo if is .
member.value: The content-type for image file format.

member.summary: Represents a class that stores saving options for Portable Document Format (PDF) file.

remarks.para: For more information about a level of support for PDF format, see supported file formats.
For more information about PDF encryption, see see remarks.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PdfSaveOptions.Permissions
member.summary: Gets or sets the operations that are allowed to a user on an encrypted PDF document.
member.value: The operations that are allowed to a user on an encrypted PDF document.

remarks.para: Generated PDF document will be encrypted if any of the following conditions are satisfied:

item.description: is different than .
is not or .
is not or .

remarks.para: Both and are optional but with the following consequences:

item.description: If is different than and is not specified, component will generate random .
Using , also known as owner password, without is not secure. It relies on PDF viewer software to respect specified restrictions, but it may choose not to do so.
Using , also known as user password, is potentially very secure. It or is required for decrypting and viewing the document.

When is specified, PDF viewer application will prompt for password to decrypt and present the document. If entered password is , document will be decrypted and presented with specified enforced. Otherwise, if entered password is , document will be decrypted and presented without any restrictions.

remarks.para: and cannot be equal, otherwise exception is thrown.
For more information, see PDF Encryption example.

GemBox.Presentation currently doesn't perform this conversion of drawing commands, instead it uses Windows GDI to execute Metafile drawing commands into bitmap which is then encoded to PNG format and embedded into PDF file.
specifies the size of the bitmap surface, based from the original Metafile surface size, into which Metafile should be drawn / rasterized.

PDF viewer will still scale the bitmap to the original Metafile size, but if the page is zoomed or viewed on a larger surface, quality of the image will be better since it contains more pixels / dots which will become visible while PDF viewer scales down the image.

increases the quality of the Metafile image in PDF file, but it also increases the size of the PDF file because greater means greater bitmap surface and more space to store bitmap pixel / color data. PNG encoding / compression helps in reducing the space requirement and for complex Metafiles (with a lot of drawing instructions), of 5 or even greater, might not incur any space overhead relative to the original (complex) Metafile.
Default value for is 1.

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.XpsSaveOptions
member.summary: Represents a class that stores saving options for XML Paper Specification (XPS) file.
member.remarks: For more information about a level of support for XPS format, see supported file formats.

member.name: M:GemBox.Presentation.XpsSaveOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.XpsSaveOptions.MetafileScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images. Greater scaling factor improves quality but also increases file size. Default value is 1.
member.value: The metafile scale factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images.

remarks.para: Windows Metafile Format (WMF) and Enhanced Metafile Format (EMF) are vector image formats which contain a series of graphics drawing commands usually executed in Windows GDI layer.
Metafile drawing commands could also be executed in PDF (or XPS) file which is also vector format, but for that Metafile drawing commands would have to be converted to PDF drawing commands.

GemBox.Presentation currently doesn't perform this conversion of drawing commands, instead it uses Windows GDI to execute Metafile drawing commands into bitmap which is then encoded to PNG format and embedded into PDF file.
specifies the size of the bitmap surface, based from the original Metafile surface size, into which Metafile should be drawn / rasterized.

PDF viewer will still scale the bitmap to the original Metafile size, but if the page is zoomed or viewed on a larger surface, quality of the image will be better since it contains more pixels / dots which will become visible while PDF viewer scales down the image.

increases the quality of the Metafile image in PDF file, but it also increases the size of the PDF file because greater means greater bitmap surface and more space to store bitmap pixel / color data. PNG encoding / compression helps in reducing the space requirement and for complex Metafiles (with a lot of drawing instructions), of 5 or even greater, might not incur any space overhead relative to the original (complex) Metafile.
Default value for is 1.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.XpsSaveOptions.ContentType
member.summary: Gets the content-type for XPS file format: application/vnd.ms-xpsdocument.
member.value: The content-type for XPS file format.

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.ActionType
member.summary: Represents actions that could happen when the user clicks on a drawing or hovers over a drawing with a pointing device such as a computer mouse.

summary.para: Nothing happens when drawing is clicked or hovered over.
This action has no parameters.
Slide show jumps to the next slide.
This action has no parameters.
Slide show jumps to the previous slide.
This action has no parameters.
Slide show jumps to the first slide.
This action has no parameters.
Slide show jumps to the last slide.
This action has no parameters.
Slide show jumps to the last slide viewed.
This action has no parameters.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.
Ends the slide show.
This action has no parameters.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.
Start the specified custom slide show with an option to return to the current slide show after the specified custom slide show has ended.
This action has the following parameters:
1. required parameter: instance of a that specifies the custom slide show that should start. The specified must be contained in the same as the current ; otherwise, exception is thrown.

2. optional parameter: value that specifies whether to return to the current slide show after the specified custom slide show has ended ( value) or to end the current slide show after the specified custom slide show has ended ( value).
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.
Slide show jumps to the specified slide.
This action has the following parameter:
1. required parameter: instance of a that specifies the slide to which the slide show should jump to. The specified must be contained in the same as the current ; otherwise, exception is thrown.
Opens the specified web page or an application (such as an e-mail client, if specified URL starts with mailto:).
This action has the following parameter:

1. required parameter: instance of a that specifies the URL that should be opened. The specified URL should not be or ; otherwise, exception is thrown. The specified URL should start with a scheme (such as http://, https://, or mailto:) and should be unescaped.
Shows the specified presentation with an option to start other presentation show from the specified slide index and with the specified slide title.
This action has the following parameters:
1. required parameter: instance of a that specifies the path to the presentation that should be shown. The specified path should not be or ; otherwise, exception is thrown.
2. optional parameter: value that specifies the slide index from which the other presentation slide show should start.
2. optional parameter: value that specifies the slide title of the first slide in the other presentation slide show.
Opens the specified file.
This action has the following parameter:
1. required parameter: instance of a that specifies the path to the file that should be opened. The specified path should not be or ; otherwise, exception is thrown.
Runs the specified program.
This action has the following parameter:
1. required parameter: instance of a that specifies the path to the program that should be run. The specified path should not be or ; otherwise, exception is thrown.
Runs the specified macro (Visual Basic procedure).
This action has the following parameter:
1. required parameter: instance of a that specifies the name to the macro that should be run. The specified name should not be or ; otherwise, exception is thrown.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.
Plays the media (for example, video or audio) associated with the current drawing.
This action has no parameters.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.
Executes an action (for example, open object or edit object) on an OLE object associated with the current drawing.
This action has the following parameter:

1. required parameter: instance of a that specifies the parameters (for example, 'verb=0' or 'verb=1') of the action that should be executed. The specified parameter should not be or ; otherwise, exception is thrown.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.System3DDark
member.summary: System '3D Dark' color. Specifies a Dark shadow color for three-dimensional display elements. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x696969, RGB = (105, 105, 105), HSL = (0, 0, 105).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.System3DLight
member.summary: System '3D Light' color. Specifies a Light color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing the light source). Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xE3E3E3, RGB = (227, 227, 227), HSL = (0, 0, 227).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemActiveBorder
member.summary: System 'Active Border' color. Specifies an Active Window Border Color. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xB4B4B4, RGB = (180, 180, 180), HSL = (0, 0, 180).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemActiveCaption
member.summary: System 'Active Caption' color. Specifies the active window title bar color. In particular the left side color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar if the gradient effect is enabled. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x99B4D1, RGB = (153, 180, 209), HSL = (150, 96, 181).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemApplicationWorkspace
member.summary: System 'Application Workspace' color. Specifies the Background color of multiple document interface (MDI) applications. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xABABAB, RGB = (171, 171, 171), HSL = (0, 0, 171).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemBackground
member.summary: System 'Background' color. Specifies the desktop background color. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x000000, RGB = (0, 0, 0), HSL = (0, 0, 0).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemButtonFace
member.summary: System 'Button Face' color. Specifies the face color for three-dimensional display elements and for dialog box backgrounds. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xF0F0F0, RGB = (240, 240, 240), HSL = (0, 0, 240).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemButtonHighlight
member.summary: System 'Button Highlight' color. Specifies the highlight color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing the light source). Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xFFFFFF, RGB = (255, 255, 255), HSL = (0, 0, 255).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemButtonShadow
member.summary: System 'Button Shadow' color. Specifies the shadow color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing away from the light source). Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xA0A0A0, RGB = (160, 160, 160), HSL = (0, 0, 160).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemButtonText
member.summary: System 'Button Text' color. Specifies the color of text on push buttons. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x000000, RGB = (0, 0, 0), HSL = (0, 0, 0).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemCaptionText
member.summary: System 'Caption Text' color. Specifies the color of text in the caption, size box, and scroll bar arrow box. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x000000, RGB = (0, 0, 0), HSL = (0, 0, 0).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemGradientActiveCaption
member.summary: System 'Gradient Active Caption' color. Specifies the right side color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xB9D1EA, RGB = (185, 209, 234), HSL = (149, 137, 210).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemGradientInactiveCaption
member.summary: System 'Gradient Inactive Caption' color. Specifies the right side color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xD7E4F2, RGB = (215, 228, 242), HSL = (150, 130, 228).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemGrayText
member.summary: System 'Gray Text' color. Specifies a grayed (disabled) text. This color is set to 0 if the current display driver does not support a solid gray color. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x6D6D6D, RGB = (109, 109, 109), HSL = (0, 0, 109).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemHighlight
member.summary: System 'Highlight' color. Specifies the color of Item(s) selected in a control. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x3399FF, RGB = (51, 153, 255), HSL = (149, 255, 153).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemHighlightText
member.summary: System 'Highlight Text' color. Specifies the text color of item(s) selected in a control. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xFFFFFF, RGB = (255, 255, 255), HSL = (0, 0, 255).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemHotLight
member.summary: System 'Hot Light' color. Specifies the color for a hyperlink or hot-tracked item. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x0066CC, RGB = (0, 102, 204), HSL = (149, 255, 102).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemInactiveBorder
member.summary: System 'Inactive Border' color. Specifies the color of the Inactive window border. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xF4F7FC, RGB = (244, 247, 252), HSL = (154, 146, 248).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemInactiveCaption
member.summary: System 'Inactive Caption' color. Specifies the color of the Inactive window caption. Specifies the left side color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar if the gradient effect is enabled. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xBFCDDB, RGB = (191, 205, 219), HSL = (149, 71, 205).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemInactiveCaptionText
member.summary: System 'Inactive Caption Text' color. Specifies the color of text in an inactive caption. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x434E54, RGB = (67, 78, 84), HSL = (142, 29, 76).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemInfoBack
member.summary: System 'Info Back' color. Specifies the background color for tooltip controls. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xFFFFE1, RGB = (255, 255, 225), HSL = (43, 255, 240).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemInfoText
member.summary: System 'Info Text' color. Specifies the text color for tooltip controls. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x000000, RGB = (0, 0, 0), HSL = (0, 0, 0).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemMenu
member.summary: System 'Menu' color. Specifies the menu background color. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xF0F0F0, RGB = (240, 240, 240), HSL = (0, 0, 240).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemMenuBar
member.summary: System 'Menu Bar' color. Specifies the background color for the menu bar when menus appear as flat menus. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xF0F0F0, RGB = (240, 240, 240), HSL = (0, 0, 240).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemMenuHighlight
member.summary: System 'Menu Highlight' color. Specifies the color used to highlight menu items when the menu appears as a flat menu. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x3399FF, RGB = (51, 153, 255), HSL = (149, 255, 153).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemMenuText
member.summary: System 'Menu Text' color. Specifies the color of Text in menus. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x000000, RGB = (0, 0, 0), HSL = (0, 0, 0).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemScrollBar
member.summary: System 'Scroll Bar' color. Specifies the scroll bar gray area color. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xC8C8C8, RGB = (200, 200, 200), HSL = (0, 0, 200).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemWindow
member.summary: System 'Window' color. Specifies window background color. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xFFFFFF, RGB = (255, 255, 255), HSL = (0, 0, 255).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ColorName.SystemWindowFrame

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.Comment
member.summary: Represents a single comment attached to a slide. It contains the text of the comment, its position on the slide, and attributes referring to its author and date.
member.remarks: A comment is a text note attached to a slide, with the primary purpose of allowing readers of a presentation to provide feedback to the presentation author.Each comment contains an unformatted text string and information about its author, and is attached to a particular location on a slide. Comments can be visible while editing the presentation, but do not appear when a slide show is given.The displaying application decides when to display comments and determines their visual appearance.

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.ComponentInfo
member.summary: Contains static licensing methods and diagnostic information about executing GemBox.Presentation assembly.

member.name: E:GemBox.Presentation.ComponentInfo.FreeLimitReached
member.summary: Occurs in loading or saving when GemBox.Presentation assembly is used with FREE-LIMITED-KEY license key and free limit is reached.
member.remarks:
This event is raised when GemBox.Presentation assembly is used with FREE-LIMITED-KEY license key and maximum number of slides per presentation is reached (5 slides).
            
Free mode will read / write first 5 slides normally and, if document has more than 5 slides, it will throw .
You can use this event to continue using the assembly in a trial mode for performance testing (set  to 
            ) or to stop further reading/writing (set  to 
            ).
            Trial mode will:
            
read the entire presentation content but interior word letters will be scrambled on random places and custom promotional header will be inserted to all slides that come after the 5-th slide.
write the entire presentation content but will insert custom promotional header to all slides that come after the 5-th slide.
For more information about GemBox.Presentation evaluation and licensing, see evaluation and licensing.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ComponentInfo.Title
member.summary: Gets GemBox.Document assembly title.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.ComponentInfo.FullVersion
member.summary: Gets GemBox.Presentation assembly full version.

member.name: M:GemBox.Presentation.ComponentInfo.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the license (serial) key.
member.param: The serial key.

remarks.para: You should call this method before using any other class from GemBox.Presentation assembly.
Key can only be set once (if you try another key, exception will be thrown).
The best place to call this method is from static constructor of your application's main class.
Valid serial key has multiple groups of alphanumeric characters, separated with dashes.
To use the assembly in free limited mode use FREE-LIMITED-KEY as .
For more information about GemBox.Presentation evaluation and licensing, see evaluation and licensing.

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.DrawingLocks
member.summary: Represents a locking settings for a drawing that inform the application about specific drawing properties that have been previously locked and thus should not be changed by the user when viewing a drawing in an application.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.DrawingLocks.None
member.summary: The application should allow any action on the current drawing - the user can change any drawing property.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.DrawingLocks.Selection
member.summary: The application should not allow selection of the current drawing - the user cannot select the drawing nor picture, shape or text attached to the drawing.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.DrawingLocks.Grouping
member.summary: The application should not allow grouping of the current drawing - the user cannot combine the drawing with other drawings to form a .

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.DrawingLocks.Position
member.summary: The application should not allow changing the position of the current drawing - the user cannot move the drawing.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.DrawingLocks.Size
member.summary: The application should not allow changing the size of the current drawing - the user cannot resize the drawing.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.DrawingLocks.AspectRatio
member.summary: The application should not allow changing the aspect ratio of the current drawing - the user cannot change the drawing's width and height independently.

summary.para: The application should not allow changing the rotation of the current geometrical shape - the user cannot rotate the shape.
Applicable to derived types (, , and ).
The application should not allow changing the type (geometry) of the current geometrical shape - the user cannot change the shape's type (geometry).
Applicable to derived types (, and ).
PowerPoint application supports changing the shape type (geometry) only for and .
The application should not allow changing the adjust handles of the current geometrical shape - the user cannot adjust the shape by sliding its adjust handle points.
Applicable to derived types (, and ).
PowerPoint application supports changing the adjust handles only for and .
The application should not allow changing the shape points of the current geometrical shape - the user cannot edit points of the shape.
Applicable to derived types (, and ).
PowerPoint application supports changing the shape points only for and .
The application should not allow changing the arrowheads of the current geometrical shape - the user cannot change the shape's arrowhead settings.
Applicable to derived types (, and ).
PowerPoint application supports changing the arrowheads only for .
The application should not allow changing the text of the current shape - the user cannot edit the shape's text.
Applicable to .
The application should not allow cropping the current picture - the user cannot change the visible part of the picture.
Applicable to .
The application should not allow ungrouping of the current group shape - the user cannot ungroup the current group shape.
Applicable to .

The application should not allow selection of objects within the current graphic frame (such as chart, diagram or table parts) but allow the selection of graphic frame itself - the user cannot select the elements of the current graphic frame (such as diagram nodes or table cells), but can select the graphic frame itself.
Applicable to .

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.FillFormatType
member.summary: Represents the fill type that can be applied to various objects, such as shapes, text characters, table cells and their outlines, borders and underlines.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.FillFormatType.None
member.summary: No fill. The shape is not filled, thus making its interior transparent.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.FillFormatType.Solid
member.summary: Solid color fill. The shape is filled entirely with the specified color.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.FillFormatType.Gradient
member.summary: Gradient fill. The shape is filled with the smooth gradual transition of colors at the specified locations that either follows a line or a path.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.FillFormatType.Picture
member.summary: Picture fill. The shape is filled with the picture that can either be tiled (as a texture) or stretched to fill the available area. This fill type is not supported for outlines, borders and underlines.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.FillFormatType.Pattern
member.summary: Pattern fill. The shape is filled with the repeated pattern of the specified foreground and background color.

summary.para: Slide background fill. The shape is filled the same as the slide background surface.
The difference between this fill and is noticeable if with fill is in front of some other filled shape.

member.summary: Represents a shape that is outlined and/or filled in locations specified by the geometric primitives such as lines, arcs and BÃ©zier curves.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.GeometryShape.ShapeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the shape (geometry).
member.value: The type of the shape (geometry).
member.exception: Value is a connector geometry type and the current shape is not a or value is not a connector geometry type and the current shape is a .

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.GeometryShape.Geometry
member.summary: Gets or sets the shape's geometry that contains additional information about the .
member.value: The shape's geometry that contains additional information about the .
member.exception: Value is a connector geometry and the current shape is not a or value is not a connector geometry and the current shape is a .

remarks.para: This property always returns a new instance of a that points to geometry data associated with this shape. This reduces memory footprint since simpler internal structures can be used to hold the geometry data and execution time increase is negligible since Garbage Collector has a very good performance for a short-lived (Generation 0) objects. Also, this behavior is required because geometry can be inherited from the placeholder (and changes in the placeholder's geometry must be immediately visible in this shape's geometry), but when the geometry is being modified, it should be modified for this shape, not for the placeholder.

When setting a value, instance of a won't actually be stored in this shape, but the geometry data to which the instance points to will be copied. This enables easy copying of complex geometries from one shape to another.

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.Length
member.summary: Represents a length, distance or a coordinate.

remarks.para: internally stores its value in an field and internally uses EMU (English Metric Unit) as a unit of measurement.

EMU (English Metric Unit) can evenly divide in both English and Metric units and can avoid rounding errors during the calculation since it defines an integer based, high precision coordinate system (1" = 914 400 EMU, 1 cm = 360 000 EMU, 1 mm = 36 000 EMU, 1 pt = 12 700 EMU).

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.Length.DefaultUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the default measurement unit that is applied globally every time is converted from/to a and to a .
member.value: The default measurement unit.

remarks.para: Initial value is .
This property makes code less verbose and, thus, easier to read and maintain because instead of using , and methods, one can use implicit conversions from/to a and to a .

Since default measurement unit is applied globally (like any other member), it is advisable not to set property or use implicit conversions from/to a and to a if GemBox.Presentation is used by various application functions that expect different default measurement unit, especially if usage is multi-threaded.

member.summary: Gets or sets the default time unit that is applied globally every time is converted from/to a .
member.value: The default time unit.

remarks.para: Initial value is .
This property makes code less verbose and, thus, easier to read and maintain because instead of using and , one can use implicit conversions from/to a .

Since default time unit is applied globally (like any other member), it is advisable not to set property or use implicit conversions from/to a if GemBox.Presentation is used by various application functions that expect different default time unit, especially if usage is multi-threaded.

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat
member.summary: Represents a fill with a picture that can either be tiled (as a texture) or stretched to fill the available area. This fill is not supported for outlines, borders and underlines.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.FillType
member.summary: Gets the value.
member.value: The value.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.Data
member.summary: Gets the picture data that has an associated content that is either embedded in or linked to the presentation file.
member.value: The picture data that has an associated content that is either embedded in or linked to the presentation file.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.RotateWithShape
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the fill should rotate with the shape.
member.value: if fill should rotate with the shape; otherwise, .
member.remarks: If set to and a shape that has been filled with a picture is transformed with a rotation, then the fill will be transformed with the same rotation.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.TileAsTexture
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the fill should tile as a texture or stretch over the filling area.
member.value: if fill should tile as a texture; otherwise, to stretch it over the filling area.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.StretchLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset (inset) of the left edge of the stretched picture fill from the left edge of the filling area specified as a relative value (percentage of the filling area width, value of 1 is equal to 100% of the filling area width).
member.value: The offset (inset) of the left edge of the stretched picture fill from the left edge of the filling area.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.StretchRight
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset (inset) of the right edge of the stretched picture fill from the right edge of the filling area specified as a relative value (percentage of the filling area width, value of 1 is equal to 100% of the filling area width).
member.value: The offset (inset) of the right edge of the stretched picture fill from the right edge of the filling area.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.StretchTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset (inset) of the top edge of the stretched picture fill from the top edge of the filling area specified as a relative value (percentage of the filling area height, value of 1 is equal to 100% of the filling area height).
member.value: The offset (inset) of the top edge of the stretched picture fill from the top edge of the filling area.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.StretchBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset (inset) of the bottom edge of the stretched picture fill from the bottom edge of the filling area specified as a relative value (percentage of the filling area height, value of 1 is equal to 100% of the filling area height).
member.value: The offset (inset) of the bottom edge of the stretched picture fill from the bottom edge of the filling area.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.TilingOffsetX
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional horizontal offset after tiling alignment.
member.value: The additional horizontal offset after tiling alignment.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.TilingScaleX
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal tiling scale in range from 0 = 0% to 1 = 100%.
member.value: The horizontal tiling scale.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.TilingOffsetY
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional vertical offset after tiling alignment.
member.value: The additional vertical offset after tiling alignment.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.TilingScaleY
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical tiling scale in range from 0 = 0% to 1 = 100%.
member.value: The vertical tiling scale.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.TilingAlignment

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating where to align the first tile with respect to the filling area.
Alignment happens after the scaling, but before the additional offset.

member.value: A value indicating where to align the first tile with respect to the filling area.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.PictureFillFormat.TilingMirrorType

summary.para: Specifies the direction(s) in which to flip the source image while tiling.
Images may be flipped horizontally, vertically, or in both directions to fill the entire region.

member.value: The direction(s) in which to flip the source image while tiling.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating the centering of the text box.

The way it works fundamentally is to determine the smallest possible "bounds box" for the text and then to center that "bounds box" accordingly. This is different than , which aligns the text within the "bounds box" for the text.
This property is compatible with all of the different kinds of .
Default value is .
This member is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.TextBoxFormat.ColumnNumber

summary.para: Gets or sets the number of columns of text in the bounding rectangle.
Default value is 1.
This property is not applicable on a within a .
This member is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.

member.value: The number of columns of text in the bounding rectangle.
member.exception: Value is less than 1.
member.remarks: When applied to a this property takes the width of the bounding box for the text and divides it by the number of columns specified. These columns are then treated as overflow containers in that when the previous column has been filled with text the next column acts as the repository for additional text. When all columns have been filled and text still remains then the overflow properties set for this are used and the text is reflowed to make room for additional text.

member.summary: Represents an enumeration of available text directions.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.TextDirection.Horizontal
member.summary: Horizontal text.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.TextDirection.Rotate90
member.summary: Text is vertical orientation (each line is 90 degrees rotated clockwise, so it goes from top to bottom; each next line is to the left from the previous one).

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.TextDirection.Rotate270
member.summary: Text is vertical orientation (each line is 270 degrees rotated clockwise, so it goes from bottom to top; each next line is to the right from the previous one).

summary.para: Text is vertical (one letter on top of another).
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.
Text is vertical (one letter on top of another) as for but should be shown from right to left rather than left to right.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.
A special version of , where some fonts are displayed as if rotated by 90 degrees while some fonts (mostly East Asian) are displayed vertical.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.

A special version of , where some fonts are displayed as if rotated by 90 degrees while some fonts (mostly East Asian) are displayed vertical. The difference between this and the is the text flows top down then LEFT RIGHT, instead of RIGHT LEFT.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.TextListFormat.NumberType

summary.para: Gets or sets the numbering scheme of the numbered list.
Default value is .
This allows specifying formats other than strictly numbers. For instance, a set of bullets can be represented by a series of Roman numerals instead of the standard 1,2,3, etc. number set.

member.value: The numbering scheme of the numbered list.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.TextListFormat.NumberStartAt

summary.para: Gets or sets the number that starts a given sequence of a numbered list.
Default value is 1 if is ; otherwise, -1.

When the numbering is alphabetical, the number should map to the appropriate letter. For instance 1 maps to 'a', 2 to 'b' and so on. If the numbers are larger than 26, then multiple letters should be used. For instance 27 should be represented as 'aa' and similarly 53 should be 'aaa'.

member.value: The number that starts a given sequence of a numbered list.
member.exception: Value is not between 1 and 32767 (inclusive).

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.TextUnknown
member.summary: Represents a text element that is not recognized by the GemBox.Presentation component.

remarks.para: This type can either represent some text element that is supported by a particular input file format supported by the GemBox.Presentation component or some user-defined text element. In either case, text element is not supported by the GemBox.Presentation component (no additional behavior or information about it can be obtained through the GemBox.Presentation API).
This type is used for preserving not supported text elements when reading and writing a presentation to a same file format.
This type can also be used for user-defined text elements.

Information contained in the property is either internal to GemBox.Presentation component (when the type is used for preserving not supported text elements) or is user-specific type (when the type is used for user-defined text elements).

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.UnknownDrawing
member.summary: Represents a drawing that is not recognized by the GemBox.Presentation component.

remarks.para: This type can either represent some drawing that is supported by a particular input file format supported by the GemBox.Presentation component or some user-defined drawing. In either case, drawing is not supported by the GemBox.Presentation component (no additional behavior or information about it can be obtained through the GemBox.Presentation API).
This type is used for preserving not supported drawings when reading and writing a presentation to the same file format.
This type can also be used for user-defined drawings, although type is more appropriate for this purpose.

Information contained in the property is either internal to GemBox.Presentation component (when the type is used for preserving not supported drawings) or is user-specific type (when the type is used for user-defined drawings).

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.UnknownDrawing.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data of this drawing.
member.value: The data of this drawing.
member.exception: Value can be set only once and it cannot be a .
member.remarks: Value type is either internal to GemBox.Presentation component (when the type is used for preserving not supported drawings) or is user-specific type (when the type is used for user-defined drawings).

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.UnknownDrawing.DrawingType
member.summary: Gets the value.
member.value: The value.

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Represents an enumeration of available vertical alignments for text.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.VerticalAlignment.Top
member.summary: Align the text to the top of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.VerticalAlignment.Middle
member.summary: Align the text to the middle of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:GemBox.Presentation.VerticalAlignment.Bottom
member.summary: Align the text to the bottom of the bounding rectangle.

summary.para: Anchor the text so that it is justified vertically.
When text is horizontal, this spaces out the actual lines of text and is almost always identical in behavior to (special case: if only 1 line, then aligned to ).
When text is vertical, then it justifies the letters vertically. This is different than , because in some cases such as very little text in a line, it does not justify.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.
Align the text so that it is distributed vertically.
When text is horizontal, this spaces out the actual lines of text and is almost always identical in behavior to (special case: if only 1 line, then aligned to ).
When text is vertical, then it distributes the letters vertically. This is different than , because it always forces distribution of the words, even if there are only one or two words in a line.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.

member.name: T:GemBox.Presentation.VisualDrawing
member.summary: Represents a base type for all drawings that have a visual appearance in a specific position and of a specific size.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.VisualDrawing.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this drawing.
member.value: The name of this drawing.
member.exception: Name cannot be , or consist only of white-space characters.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.VisualDrawing.Hidden

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this drawing is hidden. Drawing is automatically hidden if any of its ancestor is hidden.
Default value is .

member.value: if drawing or any of its ancestor is hidden; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.VisualDrawing.AlternativeText

summary.para: Gets or sets the alternative, text-based representation of the information contained in this drawing.
To remove an alternative, text-based representation from this drawing, set this property to .

member.value: The alternative, text-based representation of the information contained in this drawing.

remarks.para: This property always returns a new instance of a that points to data associated with this drawing. This reduces memory footprint since simpler internal structures can be used to hold the data and execution time increase is negligible since Garbage Collector has a very good performance for a short-lived (Generation 0) objects.

When setting a value, instance of a won't actually be stored in this drawing, but the data to which the instance points to will be copied. This enables easy copying of complex properties from one drawing to another.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.VisualDrawing.Action

summary.para: Gets or sets the action settings for this drawing that specify what should happen when the user clicks on this drawing or hovers over this drawing with a pointing device such as a computer mouse.
To remove all actions from this drawing, set this property to .

member.value: The action settings for this drawing that specify what should happen when the user clicks on this drawing or hovers over this drawing with a pointing device such as a computer mouse.

remarks.para: This property always returns a new instance of a that points to data associated with this drawing. This reduces memory footprint since simpler internal structures can be used to hold the data and execution time increase is negligible since Garbage Collector has a very good performance for a short-lived (Generation 0) objects.

When setting a value, instance of a won't actually be stored in this drawing, but the data to which the instance points to will be copied. This enables easy copying of complex properties from one drawing to another.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.VisualDrawing.Locks

summary.para: Gets or sets the locking settings for this drawing. These settings inform the application about specific drawing properties that have been previously locked and thus should not be changed by the user when viewing a drawing in an application.
Default value is .

member.value: The locking settings for this drawing.
member.remarks: Some values are applicable only to certain derived types. Specified input values will be automatically coerced to a set of valid values for a specific derived type as documented in members documentation.

member.name: P:GemBox.Presentation.VisualDrawing.Placeholder
member.summary: Gets the placeholder settings for this drawing if the drawing is a placeholder; otherwise, .
member.value: The placeholder settings for this drawing if the drawing is a placeholder; otherwise, .

remarks.para: This property always returns a new instance of a that points to data associated with this drawing.
